Text:
Caregiving is at the center of our families, communities, and economy. People rely on our nation's child and family care systems in order to work.
 
Care is infrastructure.

Care is essential.
 
#CareCantWait
https://t.co/BKU5Od4iwe

The @TheBlackCaucus & @JECDems report is clear: rising costs of childcare disproportionately harm Black mothers.

Investments in #AffordableChildCare will help families get the care they need without having to fear the price tag.
 
We must resume the monthly #ChildTaxCredit. https://t.co/EAaim3aSSd

Learn more about the museum:
https://t.co/PRRqOdHTyP

I had the opportunity to visit the Ruby and Calvin Fletcher African American History Museum in Stratford, which is absolutely profound. 

African American history lives on, and we must continue the fight for equality, justice, and opportunity. https://t.co/DQ0UQ5XoZw

As we celebrate this victory, let it fuel our work to help women across industries and occupations achieve #EqualPay for equal work. 

I'm proud that the House took swift action to pass the Paycheck Fairness Act, but we cannot rest until this legislation has been signed into law.

After a 6-year legal battle, the @USWNT has reached a monumental settlement with @ussoccer that finally provides the most successful international soccer team in the world with the compensation they have earned, including equal pay moving forward and equal World Cup bonuses. https://t.co/2W0BSGdB9q

As we celebrate #BlackHistoryMonth, I'm proud to announce this recognition at the historic Dixwell Q House, which provided a place of recreation, education, & community for many New Haven greats, such as Judge Constance Baker Motley.
 
We are so fortunate to follow in her steps.

Today we celebrated the introduction of the Congressional Tribute to the Constance Baker Motley Act of 2022.
 
My legislation honors the life of civil rights pioneer and New Haven’s own, Judge Constance Baker Motley by posthumously awarding her with a Congressional Gold Medal. https://t.co/sNXBzDeGx9

One year of leadership from @POTUS has given Americans: 

☑️6.6 million jobs
☑️the American Rescue Plan
☑️$1.2 trillion investment in infrastructure 
☑️a successful vaccination program to fight back against #COVID19
 
Let's keep the progress going.
 
Happy #PresidentsDay!
We must act quickly to extend the expanded and improved monthly Child Tax Credit—the futures of millions of children depend on it.

This is about millions of caregivers fighting to give their kids the resources they need to succeed while their government turns a blind eye. This is about millions of middle-class families who counted on the #CTC to help them meet the day-to-day costs of caring for their kids.

Without it, children have been thrust back into poverty at historic rates & families have been left in financial uncertainty. 

This is bigger than the politics of the moment. This is about millions of children being stuck in poverty when we know we have the answer to change it.

Never have we seen a policy have the immediate impact on children and families that we have seen from the monthly #ChildTaxCredit. We have the data and the real stories to prove that these payments changed lives, gave hardworking Americans a shot at a better life. https://t.co/MS20HuP4WX

We know the pandemic has heavily impacted local manufacturers, and for Bead, that meant shortages in their access to brass.
 
The House-passed #AmericaCOMPETES Act protects our critical supply chains and bolsters economic competitiveness.
 
We're putting American workers first. https://t.co/jfYfucGqXv
.@beadelectronics in Milford is a woman-led manufacturer for electric contact pins and has a robust pipeline for manufacturing apprenticeships and upskilling workers. https://t.co/MCCWkgAXWs

This funding will protect the Sound, improve environmental health and climate resilience, and mobilize economic vitality for the region.

https://t.co/lEuO58DEbv
Today I joined @EPA and my CT/NY colleagues to highlight the Infrastructure law's $106 million investment in the Long Island Sound.

Chanelle, Daniel – CT-03 is excited to watch you outwit, outplay, and outlast this season on #Survivor. We’ll be with you every step of the way. You got this!
 
I’ll be watching on March 9. Who’s with me? @survivorcbs https://t.co/UXIBCHD9Xp

Fun Fact: Max Berkowitz is my former intern! 

He's now the Principal of Foran High School, making a real difference in Connecticut by helping our students succeed. https://t.co/wPzIPerPsw

Congratulations to the @CongressionalAC winners in CT-03, Leighla-Marie Dantes and Violet Wilson at Joseph Foran High School in Milford. 
 
Their app, Olive, is a customizable nutrition app that promotes healthy eating habits by focusing on physical and mental health. https://t.co/TzsyFyiGe2

I will never forget that dark day when we lost 26 beautiful lives. While nothing can heal the deep wounds, this victory is a step forward as we continue the fight to hold gun manufacturers accountable & collectively work to enact legislation to keep guns out of the wrong hands.

For the first time in the US, a gun manufacturer has been held liable for a mass shooting. This is a historic day, one that would not be possible without the unparalleled courage of the Sandy Hook families who, despite their unspeakable pain, led this fight for nearly 8 years.
I love this. https://t.co/U2j1q7wmU0

Today we announced New Haven's annual St. Patrick's Day Parade for 2022! It’s this sense of community that fills me with pride every year, and I’m so excited to have it back on. 

Mark your calendars -- Sunday, March 13, 2022. See you there!

Also, see my throwback from 2012. https://t.co/PkXHqtN41U

Today, I join the Parkland community in remembering the 17 lives lost four years ago at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School.

May their memory never be forgotten as we continue fighting to keep our communities safe from gun violence. #MSDStrong
Their new at-home #COVID19 test produces results in less than 30 minutes! Now more than ever, we need to invest in next-generation testing to scale up our testing capacity. https://t.co/eVSjKoNoKD

@DetectTest's commitment to saving lives through technology is inspiring. Through a $30 million contract with @BARDA, Detect will be able to further develop a new combination rapid at-home test for #COVID19 and the flu. https://t.co/EVGqNTMsWd

I'm proud to be partner with @IRISNewHaven, whose mission is to help displaced people from around the world establish new lives, strengthen hope, and contribute to the vitality of our communities. https://t.co/ZLEgtqiUb4

A big thank you to all of the runners today in @IRISNewHaven's #RunForRefugee2022 5K race! 

We're here today to raise awareness, show our support, and go the extra mile to protect the services for refugees and immigrants who call CT home. https://t.co/na16WN8xB0

We’re celebrating @AveloAir’s 100th day of service at @FlyTweed! During its first 3 months, Avelo flew nearly 70,000 customers on nearly 600 flights, created 100 jobs, & has plans to add another 100 more.
 
This gives families affordable air travel & is a boom for the economy. https://t.co/k2qtmGZhu9

That’s exactly why I introduced the Schedules That Work Act yesterday with @SenWarren.

Workers and their families deserve stability and security starting with predictable work hours. #FairWorkWeek https://t.co/R9zRzVb91o

I know firsthand evictions don't occur in a vacuum.
 
The #HELPAct provides those at risk of eviction access to legal counsel, creates a database to track evictions, & prohibits credit reporting of evictions.
 
I'm proud to partner with @RepPressley & @RepCori on this bill. https://t.co/2KQnTAhP3Y

Nathan Chen is extraordinary. 

As a New Havener, I know the entire Elm City is roaring with excitement. Congratulations! @TeamUSA #WinterOlympics https://t.co/BJxNkU1gEv

By denying visas to those who commit human rights abuses against the LGBTQI+ community, the #GlobalRespectAct affirms that hate has no place in the United States.
 
I was proud to vote YES and pass this legislation today. https://t.co/R9MK9g86l4

The freedom to unionize and bargain collectively is sacrosanct.

I’m proud of Congressional staff for having the courage to speak up and demand better. Thank you @RepAndyLevin for taking this important step to protect staffers’ right to organize. 

Count me in. https://t.co/RFglvAcJdN

I know @NJGov may think differently on this issue, but New Haven remains the pizza capital of America.

Fun Fact: @SallysApizza now ships nationwide. If you ever wanted a taste of New Haven, now you can!
 
#NationalPizzaDay

“The question is no longer whether mistreatment actually occurs … but what can we do to ensure that it never happens again.” 

We must pass the Ending Forced Arbitration of Sexual Assault and Sexual Harassment Act and end the practice of forced arbitration. https://t.co/XJP6ixqn5Q
We must pass @RepCheri’s Ending Forced Arbitration Act, a historic pro-labor piece of legislation. #EndForcedArbitration

Forced Arbitration is one of the central ways in which corporate systems are rigged against working people. Survivors of sexual assault and abuse deserve the right to tell their stories. https://t.co/V4vaLVDNSl

Thank you to @NHPFL and volunteers for hosting free tax return services to families in New Haven. Looking for assistance to file your taxes? We can help.
 
Visit https://t.co/Pme3nc4DPe https://t.co/6pK38pten5

It's tax season! 

@IRSnews' Volunteer Income Tax Assistance programs can help with the #ChildTaxCredit and Earned Income Tax Credit, which is a big deal for working families in CT who rely on their refunds. https://t.co/iwpfjdK71K

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act invests  billions for critically-needed semiconductors and billions to address broken supply chains, doubling down on our commitment for American-made innovation to prevent future shortages and disruptions.

This is a big win for the American economy. https://t.co/svW4QkIDjA

We continue to see growth in our economy, creating 6.6 million jobs within the past year. 
 
Thanks to the American Rescue Plan, and successful vaccination program, Americans are back at work at a record-setting pace.
 
Wages up. Unemployment down.
https://t.co/q8uSkBBKjA

In that time, workers have taken #FMLA leave more than 315 million times. When we invest in #CareInfrastructure, families thrive. 

Next stop: PAID family and medical leave.

As Chief of Staff for @SenChrisDodd, I worked tirelessly to help pass the Family Medical Leave Act. Today marks 29 years of #FMLA protecting Americans’ right to take unpaid time off of work to care for themselves and their families.

The infrastructure bill includes $50 billion to improve our nation’s drinking water, wastewater, and storm water infrastructure.

This will help accelerate the Lake Whitney Dam improvements and fund other vital projects throughout the state of CT.
https://t.co/36gFL1A33U

The Lake Whitney Dam in CT is a key part of @SC_CT_RWA's water supply, generating 80 million gallons of water every day. 

It's now a part of 43 projects in 24 states invited to apply for approximately $6.7 billion in @EPA Water Infrastructure Finance & Innovation Act loans. https://t.co/DU3JkqVY5c

I urge all of my colleagues to vote in favor of the #AmericaCOMPETES Act. This bill recognizes the need to bring back American manufacturing and fights for good-paying jobs that cannot be outsourced.

WATCH ⬇️ https://t.co/yFLqPOe91a

During #BlackHistoryMonth , let us celebrate Black leaders, pioneers, and champions for change, whose work continues to better our communities.
 
We must honor those who took action before us and continue the fight for equality, justice, and opportunity. https://t.co/yjEEdXq4wq
Happy #LunarNewYear to my friends in Connecticut and across the world who welcome the Year of the Tiger. Wishing you, your families, and all who celebrate a healthy, happy, and prosperous New Year.

I am deeply disturbed by the bomb threats targeting HBCUs across the country.
 
I condemn those responsible and pray for the safety and wellbeing of the students, faculty, and staff who endured today’s threats. We must protect HBCUs.
.@adeibold, CT-03 will be cheering you on at the 2022 Winter @Olympics. Let's go, @TeamUSA! https://t.co/zqpoXsJWGQ

According to a 2021 study of the most challenging places to live with asthma, New Haven, CT is ranked 5th nationally. These investments will provide reliable busing service to our children, while also making the community a safer place to live. https://t.co/s2B4xA3n8P

I visited @AnsoniaSchools' Mead Elementary School to talk about @EPA's Clean School Bus Program. 

Funded by the infrastructure law, $5 billion over five years will be dedicated to replacing current buses with low or zero-emission school buses nationwide. https://t.co/XoP8L7WV8l

School busing is critical to hardworking, middle-class families across Connecticut – and the country.
 
25 million children in America ride the bus to school everyday, and how we support the environmental impact of their commute matters. https://t.co/4yic4TPcME

When Social Security does not keep up with the cost of living, or modern economic challenges, seniors are robbed of their dignity and independence. 

I'm proud to support my dear friend @RepJohnLarson's Social Security 2100: A Sacred Trust Act to fix that.  #Secure2100

We must honor their memory, listen to the stories of survivors, and share the somber lessons from the darkest chapter in human history.

May we all be united in our solemn promise: never again.
Today, on International Holocaust Remembrance Day, I join the world in honoring the six million innocent Jewish men, women, and children and millions of others murdered during the Holocaust.

This project will help reduce congestion, improve both vehicle and pedestrian safety, and increase access to the waterfront. This investment will help Connecticut create jobs and build a better, stronger economy. https://t.co/CMrVTMBMBV

We could not be more proud. 
https://t.co/8lmNjdGzHN

The arts play a vital, valuable role in our communities, and local artists deserve our support. 

That’s why I’m joining @NEAarts, @NewHavenArts, and @CTOfficeofArts for a virtual forum on how to apply for congressional art grants this Friday, January 28th at 9 AM! https://t.co/0inRvcaYnC

Tax filing season is here!
 
If you received advance #ChildTaxCredit payments last year, you can claim the other half of your expanded credit — up to $1,800 per child — by filing your tax return – free of charge.
 
Visit https://t.co/Kj8U27hdV6 for filing assistance:

Throughout his 32-year career in the House, @repjimcooper has been a steadfast advocate for the people of Tennessee. A dear friend and a trusted partner, I'm proud to serve alongside Jim. I wish him and his family well as they embark on the next adventure. https://t.co/yb7362iFiR

This project is a real economic benefit to the region and will increase the safety of boats in the Milford Harbor. This is a big deal! 

This historic investment will create jobs and help CT to build a better, stronger economy.

.@CorpsNewEngland has completed navigation projects at 28 different sites in Connecticut, including rivers, bays, coves, and harbors.
 
Today we celebrated securing $5 million in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law that will fund the dredging project here in Milford. https://t.co/c3mpodMoKO
Beyond this study, the evidence is clear. The #ChildTaxCredit helps babies and children build better lives - we must extend it!

The #BabysFirstYears clinical trial is the first direct study of poverty reduction in the U.S. to focus on early childhood.

The groundbreaking findings indicate that cash stipends, similar to the monthly #ChildTaxCredit, improve babies’ brain function.
https://t.co/gicayxaTE6

We know that this critical project will boost Connecticut’s economy. It will create-good paying jobs for longshoremen, truck drivers, warehousemen, and construction workers and strengthen CT’s supply chain. https://t.co/LNFKAJfOfF

Today at @newhavenpublic1's Sound School, we celebrated $63 million in federal funding for a crucial project that will deepen the federal navigation channel, maneuvering area, and turning basin to allow larger vessels to efficiently access port terminals. https://t.co/v8oAeguTeH

From the beginning of this effort, I've been pushing for the New Haven Navigation Improvement Project to be included as one of the accelerated projects under the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. https://t.co/sRosy0oo63

#Roe49 comes at a pivotal moment in the fight for reproductive freedom. 

With the Supreme Court deliberations on a case that directly challenges our constitutional rights, abortion rights and access are on the line like never before. https://t.co/2JQgQNOW9E

Since taking office, @POTUS has bolstered domestic manufacturing, kept supply chains moving, and increased good-paying union jobs — all of which can be felt by small businesses in CT-03.

There is very little we can do to prevent natural disasters, but we can—and must—be proactive about preparing and minimizing damage. 

I'm proud these relief funds will help protect Long Wharf from floods, increase navigation efficiency, and safety of our harbor. ⬇️

The #EVESTAct is about meeting our responsibilities to our servicemembers and supporting veterans.

Today, I voted to pass @RepMarkTakano's EVEST Act, which will automatically enroll all eligible veterans into @DeptVetAffairs healthcare services.

Right now, the Senate is debating voting rights protections during an unprecedented wave of state voter suppression laws. 

As Republicans introduce hundreds of restrictive, anti-voter bills, the need to restore federal oversight has never been more urgent.

Your weekly reminder: It’s not too late to get your flu shot!

This project will increase the navigation efficiency and safety of the New Haven Harbor. It will create good-paying jobs for longshoremen, truck drivers, warehousemen, and construction workers and strengthen Connecticut’s supply chain. https://t.co/xKamxcutTF

We are so fortunate to have this opportunity every year to meditate on Dr. King’s legacy, to pause and ponder his reminders that, “every step toward the goal of justice requires sacrifices, suffering, and struggle." https://t.co/Xpplv1iH2y

As we march, we march against racism, against poverty, against economic inequality, against injustice everywhere, & against the constellation of inequities that Dr. King dedicated himself to solving. 

We march forward with Dr. King as our drum major for justice and democracy. https://t.co/6UKQ3PNFUL

The Love March, which began more than a half century ago by the late Pastor George W. Hampton, is an event that has had a profound impact on burnishing the legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. here in Connecticut.

#MLKDay https://t.co/geyWo4XvkW
You are an inspiration to us all @bsw5020. I am grateful for your courage and honored to be a part of your story. https://t.co/oJ76CzoFy6
This is just the beginning of many infrastructure improvements we can expect to see across the state, all while providing good-paying jobs to people right here in Connecticut. https://t.co/LKf4VlOoZm

Through the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, CT will receive nearly $561.5 million over the next five years so we can repair, replace, and rehabilitate other bridges in our state – just like we did here at the Grand Avenue Bridge! https://t.co/ugQjvWYAIO

New Haven's historic Grand Avenue bridge has been closed for nearly two years, & will reopen on Jan. 18!

We know communities need reliable infrastructure, & this is a major step in reconnecting our neighborhoods. We are investing in opportunity, jobs, & economic growth for CT. https://t.co/hKl4QtCjIe

Thrilled to visit the @AccessHealthCT Hamden enrollment fair to help the community enroll in health insurance for 2022.

Thank you to staff and volunteers for all of your hard work. The last day to enroll is today, January 15. Don’t wait! 

#GetCoveredCT https://t.co/tChBxghhYz

The evidence is clear: in six months, the expanded #ChildTaxCredit shored up family finances amidst the continuing crisis, reduced child poverty and food insufficiency, and increased families’ ability to meet their basic needs. 

We cannot let this progress end here. https://t.co/VqfgVM5kUh
Whether it’s New Haven, CT, or Rockford, IL, families across the country are counting on Congress to extend the monthly #ChildTaxCredit payments. https://t.co/vDj3ajhIxb
.@RepMGS is right. These payments have been a lifeline. We cannot go backward. America's children are counting on us. https://t.co/RHPEagnv2f

I am so proud of my staff member Harper. Thank you for sharing your story. 
https://t.co/vLCFzIAHL4
Watch as we reflect on the January 6th attack on our democracy⤵️ https://t.co/ogqDg0vWrG

A year later, it is still difficult to comprehend the gravity of this attack on our democracy. As we reflect on that horrific day filled with great sadness and lasting trauma, may we recognize that, above all, American democracy is resilient. My statement: https://t.co/rfhVGVjOWg

On January 6, 2021, I called my husband while lying on the floor of the House gallery to tell him I was safe, to reassure our family that everything would be alright. I remember hesitating before saying "I love you"—the moment harkened back to September 11, 2001.

It has been my privilege to work with @RepLawrence, a tenacious fighter for hard-working middle class families and a fierce advocate for women’s issues. I wish her and her family all the best on this new journey together. https://t.co/1VLKmbgVeG

A trailblazer, @RepRoybalAllard has been critical in the success of @AppropsDems and the Congress. It has been an honor to sit beside Lucille & I wish her, her husband Edward, & their family the very best as they prepare for a new chapter. https://t.co/hi82aJTvEM
